intro: Crepis foetida var. rhoeadifolia, commonly known as the stinking sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It has a short life cycle, typically completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. The species is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environments.
